posts.subject: SHTF on 16 April 2021?
posts.body:
> Wtf?
Convergence of three independent reports. One validates the other.

In November 2020 there was a Belgian anon on 4chan/pol/ dropping leaks from UN agenda. Allegedly his step-dad works in UN.
https://archive.4plebs.org/pol/thread/291518140/#291519004

Great Reset is supposed to start on 16 April 2021 by shutting down banks and thus all international payments for a year.
https://archive.4plebs.org/pol/thread/285913064/

This means problems with electricity and food for importing countries. Expected riots for 6 weeks and increased mortality rate in 2021, mostly in the least independent countries.
https://archive.4plebs.org/pol/thread/285913064/#285915398
> 1100% more deads than average in Bangladesh in 2021.
> 300% more deads than average per year in Germany-UK-SKorea-Japan-India
> 200% more deads than average per year in France-Ukraine-Italy-Poland for 2021.
> 100% more deads than average per year in Spain-Romania- China- Turkey for 2021.
> 50% more deads than average per year in South America for 2021.

This Belganon was posting pictures in >>86a1307c-8b0b-4c18-a42a-49dd93d19264 and >>c5326a07-6b43-490f-90bd-f197c02faee0 for the whole November. Of course he could be larping, HOWEVER. Graham Summers, who supposedly foresaw financial crisis of 2008, Greek debt crisis and Brexit, pulled out his forecasts at
https://pro.threefounders-news.org/p/SSI_SSIDeathSpiral_1120/LSSIWB34/
and they dovetail nicely with what Belganon was saying.

A bit about the guy (from https://nobsimreviews.com/strategic-impact-graham-summers/)
>Graham is a renowned economist with more than two decades of experience in the finance industry.
>Over the last fifteen years, he has been providing investment insights to clients who include top-tier political advisors, high net worth individuals, and strategists of mega financial institutions, just to mention a few. 
> He has solid knowledge in geopolitics and knows his way around high-impact investing. Thus, if you are looking to approach investment from that perspective, Graham Summers is the ideal person to follow.

The analysis is in some insufferable form of online presentation, so I screencapped slides and compiled them in one image. Two, actually.

The first one describes situation in USA after 2008 crisis.

The second one describes our current situation. In short:
> Two largest US banks JP Morgan Chase and Wells Fargo will be reporting earnings on the same day 14 April 2021.
> This will uncover the amount of loan defaults in the crippled economy.
> This in turn will cause panic and initiate death spiral.
> Global market will crash like in 2008, but way worse.

Now connect it with Belganon saying global banks bankruptcy will be announced on 16 April 2021, two days later.

Put everything in the context of leaked Canadian agenda and it starts sounding convincingly. 
> April - June:
> Economic instability
> Projected supply chain disruptions
> inventory shortages
The pic in >>134cdb6a-8f7e-4920-9a34-790cb9ca11b9 is a "derived work", based on the original email from this pic.
Regardless of reality, the theory itself is a disgusting case of anthropocentrism. Why should equity be achieved only among homo sapiens species? Das raycis. One race - mammals race.

posts.subject: 4chan/pol filter
posts.body:
We would all like to see this place grow, but the truth is 4chan/pol will remain the main "free" speech city square for the foreseeable future. Have a filter, frens, to survive somehow in the piles of shit being dumped there.
https://ghostbin.co/paste/dz9gb

>>7e9ae71f-1e37-48bf-a868-d3459edc6b3a
That's why I used quotation marks.

Shill this place, anon. Time to move out of 4chan, and normienet in general.

It's obvious by now that "free speech" is a White ideal that can be sustained only in the homogeneous White community. In the global context it will always be exploited by those who perceive the world through only one lens - the lens of self-interest - uncontaminated by any higher ideal, any notion of universality, any sense of justice and truth. Yet another white pearl dropped before swine for them to stomp it and smear in mud, along with democracy, human rights, equality, fraternity and compassion. Chinks, spics, niggers, sandniggers, and (((them))) especially - the lowest of the low, the devil's spawn, the disease, the parasite, the bottom of the barrel of human filth, the shitstain which penetrated through sole and poisoned the blood - all this swarm of solipsistic locust that crept onto body and started eating it alive...

Let's shake it off, brothers and sisters, let's hide in the clean house. Close the doors and windows, extract those ticks and leeches, heal the weakening diseases. We forgot the importance of good hygiene, or mistook, rather, the paw for the palm in the trustful handshake.

> Most people are skeptical because of cp, and because it may not help us "that much".
Technically the only thing it gives us (quite a big thing, actually) is resistance to shitting it down. Anonymity is even worse than on normienet and the efficiency of browsing is also noticeably worse. The ease of use is surprisingly good, although still requiring more attention to track size limits of the seeded sites, their content, etc. 

So from the practical perspective the only thing it's better than normienet is a narrow domain of things theoretically legal, but in practice guaranteeing censorship, or theoretically illegal (so automatically refused to being hosted on normienet), but not persecuted in practice.

That's in the default mode. In the TOR mode the possibilities are much wider and can include everything illegal, but then what exactly does ZeroNet offer that hidden onion services don't? From the host perspective definitely higher security in not glowing with the TOR node, but the user will have to deal with all the potentially illegal content on his/her device, so the total security will be lower.

Indeed it doesn't help that much. What is important, I think, is the potential of peer-to-peer networks to preserve freedom of speech in the - no doubt - increasingly authoritarian future. We want people to get accustomed with p2p technology, to have apps installed and be familiarized with them, to have their favorite pages bookmarked and be more or less fluent in navigating this parallel cyberspace, so they have safety net to fall on in case of normienet blackout. This is the true value of ZeroNet, but it will never be widely appreciated until it's too late. Practical arguments won't work.

We should try a different angle. Let's create in the collective consciousness the association:
> Peer-to-peer network = place for NWO rebels
Let's just make it cool to use ZeroNet. We can spread memes similar to fashwave in style, inducing the feeling of revolt, of freedom and independence, having zeronet logo somewhere and a few links. We can exploit the archetype of the revolting cyber-punk joining the underground network. We can create the aura of ZeroNet fraternity waiting for anons spit out by the ruthless system.

This is in fact the birth of the new Internet. Everyone who missed it in 80s and 90s gets a second chance now. How can this NOT be cool? Let's leverage that.

Do you get what I mean, anons?

>>e6869d98-8f2c-4ffc-a66a-254084c9ba46
>shitting it down
shutting* it down, lol

>>e6869d98-8f2c-4ffc-a66a-254084c9ba46
Better version in pic.

In a similar thread anon said
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1AtvCHH1vmbBNeoaKKzWZGZgBKY8SDHYGx:pol:c5e01f44-af50-4b92-9eb0-7534c889cc6d:50#post-4afc7e61-2068-4571-81e2-f1758f95fa55
> I may have an idea : we just tell people about decentralization through memes. It may look forced, but it'll work. And if we just meme decentralization, without talking about millchan (or other alternatives) people will either find alternatives by themselves, or be more attracted by millchan if we ever talk about it.
This goes well with what I said, but generalizes it nicely on the decentralization as a whole.

>>4afc7e61-2068-4571-81e2-f1758f95fa55
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1AtvCHH1vmbBNeoaKKzWZGZgBKY8SDHYGx:pol:3f59c5da-dfd8-4d40-b7d6-dd99dfc56faf#post-ace19355-6dd3-402e-96bf-1aaaaff921d3
Drop memes in that thread, frens.
